comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content:
17th Connecticut Infantry Monument, sculptured by W. H. Curtis. It was installed June 24, 1884, and dedicated July 1, 1884. The inscription on the reverse side is:
ERECTED BY THE SURVIVORS/OF THE/17TH REGIMENT, CONNECTICUT VOLUNTEERS./2ND BRIGADE, 1ST DIVISION, 11TH CORPS,/IN MEMORY OF THEIR GALLANT COMRADES/ WHO FELL HERE ON THE 1ST DAY./AND ON THIS BATTLEFIELD ON THE 2ND & 3RD DAYS OF JULY/1863/17TH CONN. VOL'S. signed
Four plaques on the monument list the names of the thirty-five men in the 17th Connecticut Infantry killed during the battle of Gettysburg. – SIRIS   Barlow's Knoll Monument – Then & Now "Summit of Barlow's Knoll, Gettysburg c.1913" from Bain/LOC   "17th Connecticut Infantry Monument (2007)" by Just Me
